headline: Sam's Club copies Costco’s expanded hours in member-friendly way

headline: Mortgage rates decline, UiPath gains on Nvidia, OpenAI partnership
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including mortgage rates declining week-over-week, UiPath (PATH) extending its stock rally after announcing an agentic AI partnership with OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) and Nvidia (NVDA), and Costco Wholesale (COST) releasing strong sales figures for September. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Why Costco stock is the boring investment your portfolio needs
summary: Very few companies have a true moat around there business. In most cases, a rival can find a way to beat its prices, match any services it offers, and compete in unexpected ways. Costco (COST) does not have a unique business as Sam's Club and BJ's Wholesale operate under the same model, ...

headline: Amazon Prime’s Big Deal Days Were a Success. Here’s What Items People Bought.
summary: Amazon.com’s Prime Big Deal Days were a hit with deal-hunting consumers looking to stock up on household essentials, early data suggests.  Analysts expected Amazon’s two-day October sale, which ended Wednesday, to kick-start the holiday shopping season.  Amazon’s website traffic increased about 21% in the first 36 hours of Prime Big Deal Days compared with the prior five days, marking a “robust response” to the sales, writes Joseph Feldman, an analyst at Telsey Advisory Group, citing data from Google Trends.

content.title: Amazon Prime’s Big Deal Days Were a Success. Here’s What Items People Bought.
content.summary: Amazon.com’s Prime Big Deal Days were a hit with deal-hunting consumers looking to stock up on household essentials, early data suggests. headline: Wall Street's feverish rally takes a break as US stocks and gold pull back from their records
summary: Wall Street took a pause on Thursday as U.S. stocks and even the price of gold pulled back from record highs following torrid runs.  The S&P 500 slipped 0.3% from its latest all-time high for just its second loss in the last 10 days.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 243 points, or 0.5%, and the Nasdaq composite edged down by 0.1%.

content.title: Wall Street's feverish rally takes a break as US stocks and gold pull back from their records
content.summary: Wall Street took a pause on Thursday as U.S. stocks and even the price of gold pulled back from record highs following torrid runs.  The S&P 500 slipped 0.3% from its latest all-time high for just its second loss in the last 10 days.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 243 points, or 0.5%, and the Nasdaq composite edged down by 0.1%.

thumbnail.caption: John O'Hara works on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange in New York, Wednesday, Oct. 1, 2025. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig)
